==Events==
*[[371 BC]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Leuctra]], where [[Epaminondas]] defeated [[Cleombrotus I]], takes place
* [[640]] &ndash; [[Battle of Heliopolis]]: The [[Muslim]] Arab army under [['Amr ibn al-'As]] defeat the [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] forces near [[Heliopolis (ancient)|Heliopolis]] ([[Diocese of Egypt (Late Antiquity)|Egypt]]).
*[[1044]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Ménfő]] between troops led by [[Henry III, Holy Roman Emperor|Emperor Henry III]] and [[Hungarian people|Magyar]] forces led by [[Samuel Aba of Hungary|King Samuel]] takes place.
*[[1189]] &ndash; [[Richard I of England|Richard I "the Lionheart"]] accedes to the English throne.
*[[1253]] &ndash; [[Mindaugas]] is crowned King of [[Lithuania]].
*[[1348]] &ndash; [[Pope Clement VI]] issues a [[papal bull]] [[Antisemitism#Persecutions in the Middle Ages|protecting]] the [[Jews in the Middle Ages#Black Death|Jews accused]] of having caused the [[Black Death]].
*[[1411]] &ndash; [[Ming Dynasty|Ming China]]'s Admiral [[Zheng He]] returns to [[Nanjing]] after the [[Treasure voyages#Third voyage|third treasure voyage]] and presents the [[Sinhala people|Sinhalese]] king, captured during the [[Ming–Kotte War]], to the [[Yongle Emperor]].
*[[1415]] &ndash; [[Jan Hus]] is burned at the stake.
*[[1483]] &ndash; [[Richard III of England|Richard III]] is crowned King of England.
*[[1484]] &ndash; Portuguese sea captain [[Diogo Cão]] finds the mouth of the [[Congo River]].
*[[1495]] &ndash; [[First Italian War]]: [[Battle of Fornovo]] &ndash; [[Charles VIII of France|Charles VIII]] defeats the [[Italian War of 1494–98|Holy League]].
*[[1535]] &ndash; [[Thomas More|Sir Thomas More]] is executed for [[treason]] against King [[Henry VIII of England]].
*[[1557]] &ndash; [[Philip II of Spain|King Philip II of Spain]], consort of [[Mary I of England|Queen Mary I of England]], sets out from [[Dover]] to war with France, which eventually resulted in the loss of the City of [[Calais]], the last [[Countries of the United Kingdom|English]] possession on the continent, and Mary I never seeing her husband again.
*[[1560]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Edinburgh]] is signed by Scotland and England.
*[[1573]] &ndash; [[Córdoba, Argentina]], is founded by [[Jerónimo Luis de Cabrera]].
*[[1609]] &ndash; [[Bohemia]] is granted [[freedom of religion]].
*[[1614]] &ndash; [[Żejtun]] and the surrounding villages [[Raid of Żejtun|suffer a raid]] from [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] forces. 
*[[1630]] &ndash; [[Thirty Years' War]]: 4,000 Swedish troops under [[Gustavus Adolphus of Sweden|Gustavus Adolphus]] land in [[Pomerania]], Germany.
*[[1751]] &ndash; Pope [[Benedict XIV]] suppresses the [[Patriarchate of Aquileia (Episcopal)|Patriarchate of Aquileia]] and establishes from its territory the Arch[[diocese]] of [[Udine]] and [[Gorizia]].
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Siege of Fort Ticonderoga (1777)|Siege of Fort Ticonderoga]] &ndash; After a bombardment by British [[artillery]] under General [[John Burgoyne]], [[United States|American forces]] retreat from [[Fort Ticonderoga]], New York.
*[[1779]] &ndash; [[Battle of Grenada]]: The French defeat British naval forces during the [[American Revolutionary War]].
*[[1785]] &ndash; The [[United States dollar|dollar]] is unanimously chosen as the [[monetary unit]] for the United States.
*[[1801]] &ndash; [[First Battle of Algeciras]]: Outnumbered [[French Navy]] ships defeat the [[Royal Navy]] in the fortified Spanish port of [[Algeciras]].
*[[1809]] &ndash; The second day of the [[Battle of Wagram]]; France defeats the Austrian army in the largest battle to date of the Napoleonic Wars.
*[[1854]] &ndash; In [[Jackson, Michigan]], the first convention of the [[United States Republican Party]] is held.
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Louis Pasteur]] successfully tests his [[vaccine]] against [[rabies]] on [[Joseph Meister]], a boy who was bitten by a rabid dog.
*[[1887]] &ndash; [[David Kalakaua]], monarch of the [[Kingdom of Hawaii]], is forced at gunpoint by Americans to sign the [[Bayonet Constitution]] giving Americans more power in Hawaii while stripping [[native Hawaiians|Hawaiian citizens]] of their rights.
*[[1892]] &ndash; [[Dadabhai Naoroji]] is elected as the first Indian [[British House of Commons|Member of Parliament]] in Britain.
*  1892   &ndash; 3,800 [[strike action|striking]] steelworkers engage in a day-long battle with [[Pinkerton National Detective Agency|Pinkerton]] agents during the [[Homestead Strike]], leaving 10 dead and dozens wounded.
*[[1893]] &ndash; The small town of [[Pomeroy, Iowa]], is nearly destroyed by a [[tornado]] that killed 71 people and injured 200.
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Arab]]ian troops led by [[T. E. Lawrence]] ("Lawrence of Arabia") and [[Auda ibu Tayi]] capture [[Battle of Aqaba|Aqaba]] from the [[Ottoman Empire]] during the [[Arab Revolt]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; The British [[airship|dirigible]] [[R34 (airship)|R34]] lands in New York, completing the first crossing of the Atlantic Ocean by an airship.
*[[1933]] &ndash; The first [[Major League Baseball All-Star Game]] is played in Chicago's [[Comiskey Park]]. The [[American League]] defeated the [[National League]] 4–2.
*[[1936]] &ndash; A major breach of the [[Manchester, Bolton and Bury Canal]] in England sends millions of gallons of water cascading {{convert|200|ft|m}} into the [[River Irwell]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]]: the last remaining Jewish enterprises in Germany are closed.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Storey Bridge]], a major landmark in [[Brisbane]], as well as Australia's longest cantilever bridge is formally opened.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[Nazi Germany]] launches its [[Battle of Smolensk (1941)|offensive to encircle several Soviet armies]] near [[Smolensk]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[Anne Frank]] and her family go into hiding in the "[[Anne Frank House|Secret Annexe]]" above her father's office in an [[Amsterdam]] warehouse.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Jackie Robinson]] refuses to move to the back of a bus, leading to a [[court martial]].
*  1944   &ndash; The [[Hartford Circus Fire]], one of America's worst [[list of historic fires|fire disasters]], kills approximately 168 people and injures over 700 in [[Hartford, Connecticut]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[AK-47]] goes into production in the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Althea Gibson]] wins the [[Wimbledon championships]], becoming the first black athlete to do so.
*  1957   &ndash; [[John Lennon]] and [[Paul McCartney]] meet for the first time, as teenagers at Woolton Fete, 3 years before forming the Beatles.
*[[1962]] &ndash; As a part of [[Operation Plowshare]], the [[Sedan (nuclear test)|Sedan nuclear test]] takes place.
*  1962   &ndash; ''[[The Late Late Show]]'', the world's longest-running [[Talk show|chat show]] by the same broadcaster, airs on [[RTÉ One]] for the first time.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Malawi]] declares its independence from the United Kingdom.
*[[1966]] &ndash; Malawi becomes a [[republic]], with [[Hastings Banda]] as its first [[Heads of State of Malawi|President]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Nigerian Civil War]]: [[Nigerian]] forces invade [[Biafra]], beginning the war.
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Comoros]] declares independence from France.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Davis Phinney]] becomes the first American cyclist to win a road stage of the [[Tour de France]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; The [[Piper Alpha]] drilling platform in the [[North Sea]] is destroyed by explosions and fires. 167 oil workers are killed, making it the world's worst offshore oil disaster in terms of direct loss of life.
*[[1989]] &ndash; The [[Tel Aviv–Jerusalem bus 405 suicide attack]]: 14 bus passengers are killed when an [[Arab]] assaulted the bus driver as the bus was driving by the edge of a cliff.
*[[1995]] &ndash; In the [[Bosnian War]], under the command of General [[Ratko Mladić]], Serbia begins its attack on the Bosnian town of [[Srebrenica]], [[Srebrenica Massacre|and kills more than 8000]] [[Bosniaks]], in what then- UN Secretary-General [[Boutros Boutros-Ghali]] called "the worst crime on European soil since the Second World War".
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: In response to the [[Drumcree conflict|Drumcree dispute]], five days of [[1997 nationalist riots in Northern Ireland|mass protests, riots and gun battles]] begin in Irish nationalist districts of [[Northern Ireland]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; U.S. Army private [[Barry Winchell]] dies from baseball-bat injuries inflicted on him in his sleep the previous day by a fellow soldier, [[Calvin Glover]], for his relationship with [[transgender]] showgirl and former [[Navy]] [[Corpsman]] [[Calpernia Addams]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; The 70-metre [[Eupatoria]] Planetary Radar sends a [[Message to Extra-Terrestrial Intelligence|METI]] message ([[Cosmic Call|Cosmic Call 2]]) to 5 stars: [[Cassiopeia (constellation)|Hip 4872]], [[Orion (constellation)|HD 245409]], [[55 Cancri]] (HD 75732), [[HD 10307]] and [[47 Ursae Majoris]] (HD 95128). The messages will arrive to these stars in 2036, 2040, 2044 and 2049 respectively.
*[[2006]] &ndash; The [[Nathula|Nathula Pass]] between India and China, sealed during the [[Sino-Indian War]], re-openes for trade after 44 years.
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least 42 people are killed in a [[Yobe State school shooting|shooting]] at a school in [[Yobe State]], [[Nigeria]].
*  2013   &ndash; A [[Boeing 777]] operating as [[Asiana Airlines]] [[Asiana Airlines Flight 214|Flight 214]] crashes at [[San Francisco International Airport]], killing 3 and injuring 181 of the 307 people on board.
*  2013   &ndash; A 73-car oil train [[Lac-Mégantic derailment|derails]] in the town of [[Lac-Mégantic, Quebec]] and explodes into flames, killing at least 47 people and destroying more than 30 buildings in the town's central area.
